alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 12:51AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, southwestern Jackson and southern Rockcastle Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1251 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hansford, or 8 miles south of Mount Vernon, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Billows around 1255 AM EDT. Luner, Sand Hill and Pine Hill around 100 AM EDT. Hazel Patch, Camp Wildcat, Hare, Wood Creek Lake, Lamero, Gauley, Horse Lick and Bernstadt around 105 AM EDT. London, Victory, East Bernstadt, Mershons, Eberle, Carmichael, Templer, Cruise, Pittsburg and Parrot around 110 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Greenmount, Atlanta, Mcwhorter, Moores Creek, Peoples, Langnau, Green Hill, Cornelius, Bond and Maplesville. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 40 and 58. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 2 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 34 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
